Likes: pink-purple-blue palettes (cohesive gradients/accents; not hard split halves)
symmetry (balanced composition within one cohesive world; no left/right split)
coastal/ocean scenery with a city backdrop

Dislikes: couple pasted like a sticker / awkwardly slotted into a corner

Likes: crisp sharp detail (when it suits the subject)
couple integrated naturally/organically into the scene (not pasted)
bright daylight / golden hour / luminous optimistic lighting
clean, polished, well-maintained materials (polished stone, glossy glass, clean ceramic)
clear luminous water with sparkling reflections
one cohesive environment with layered details to explore
Dislikes: split-scene/diptych composition (left half/right half, central seam/border/scar, two shores)

Likes: balanced framing using arches, canals, radial gardens, terraces

Dislikes: couple tiny/secondary or posed without interaction

Likes: landmark + path + destination composition (lighthouse, aqueduct, bridge, observatory)
mechanism-driven storytelling with visible cause-and-effect (atlas reshapes coast, aqueduct brings gardens, lantern controls light)
subtle holiday vibe via lighting/material warmth (1-2 motifs max)
Dislikes: greeting-card framing (wreath/garland border) or holiday decor overload

Likes: wardrobe/styling as aesthetics (if beauty/fashion theme appears), not products
scene-first focus (environment + couple), props always secondary
storybook illustration / gouache / travel-poster / animated-film look (clearly non-photoreal)
single meaningful symbol only if diegetic (held/used/worn)
Dislikes: paired dominant symbols (two orbs/panels/frames) used to explain 'two worlds/options'

Likes: grand/majestic scale achieved through clean geometry and uplifting design
Dislikes: trauma/ruin vocabulary (haunted, survivors, oppressive, scars, shouted orders)

Likes: cross-cultural romance shown as blended motifs within one shared festival/place
